title: UMN begins developing framework for future design of campus
author: Abbey Machtig
synopsis: The master plan will outline goals for the next 10-15 years to help develop the physical Twin Cities campus.

title: Minneapolis Ward 2 City Council challenger brings grassroots approach to change
author: Samantha Hendrickson, City Reporter
synopsis: Robin Wonsley Worlobah is vying for the seat in the November election with a focus on the working class and community organizing.

title: Oaks TW Hardware closes after 109 years in Southeast Como
author: Lydia Morrell, City Reporter
synopsis: Owner Patrick Clough and his dog Frankie have long provided a sense of community in the ever-shifting neighborhood, residents say.

title: Palmer’s Bar fundraiser aids reopening
author: Lydia Morrell
synopsis: After closing in November, the West Bank mainstay plans to reopen with help from several community fundraisers.

title: University researchers explore potential of microalgae in agriculture
author: Becca Most, Campus Activities Reporter
synopsis: Microalgae can return nutrients to the soil and contribute to better plant growth.

title: Gabel talks fall 2021 semester, with goal of increasing in-person instruction
author: Abbey Machtig
synopsis: The University president said course formats for fall semester, as well as study abroad programs, will be dependent on public health guidelines.

title: TRIO Student Support Services will extend to a four-year program next fall
author: Katelyn Vue, Campus Activities Reporter
synopsis: The program, which supports students from disadvantaged backgrounds, received a grant last August to fund the extension.

title: The Chauvin trial: What you need to know
author: Emalyn Muzzy, City Reporter
synopsis: Derek Chauvin is charged with murdering George Floyd. Here’s what to expect in court next week.

title: ‘It feels human’: George Floyd Square celebrates Black joy with art
author: Jasmine Snow, City Reporter
synopsis: Nearing the end of Black History Month, community members at East 38th Street and Chicago Avenue held space to celebrate life in a gathering with performing artists.
